meanings.definition: The firm flesh around the teeth in the mouth.
meanings.sent1: Her gums were pink and healthy.
meanings.sent2: The dentist checked her gums for any signs of disease.
meanings.sent3: The bubblegum got stuck on his gums, making him look silly.
meanings.sent4: His smile revealed gums as strong as a fortress.
meanings.sent5: The toddler's gums were so tender, she couldn't eat solid food.

meanings.definition: A sticky substance used in making candy and medicine.
meanings.sent1: The recipe called for mixing sugar with gums.
meanings.sent2: The pharmacist added gums to the cough syrup for flavor.
meanings.sent3: The sticky gums made it hard to open the candy wrapper.
meanings.sent4: Her fingers were covered in gums after making the caramel.
meanings.sent5: The ancient remedy included a secret ingredient of magical gums.

meanings.sent1: He had to gum his food after losing his dentures.
meanings.sent2: Babies often gum on toys to soothe their teething pain.
meanings.sent3: She tried to gum the tough steak but gave up quickly.
meanings.sent4: The old man could only gum his favorite snack now.
meanings.sent5: The puppy would eagerly gum anything within reach.
